name: 黃如瑩
objective: The purpose of this course is to create a context for our students to clearly express themselves and to effectively communicate with others in English with conscious efforts and by repeated practice.
schedule:
Syllabus:
Week 1: Introduction
Theme One: To familiarize yourself with the new environment
Week 2: Meeting new friends
Week 3: Getting around on campus
Week 4: Going grocery shopping
Week 5:  Responding to emergencies
Theme Two: To familiarize yourself with the city
Week 6: main attractions
Week 7: transportation
Week 8: living cost
Week 9 (Mid-term exam week): midterm group presentations
Theme Three: Facing challenges in the classroom
Week 10: My strengths and weakness
Week 11: How to improve my English proficiency?
Week 12: Resources for learning on campus
Week 13: Resources for self-learning on the internet
Week 14: Emotional difficulties
Theme Four: Finding out what I really like to do in life
Week 15: What am I good at?
Week 16: A job for money or for joy?
Week 17: What does success mean for me? 
Week 18 (Final examination week): Final group presentations
scorePolicy:
I. Weekly performance in classroom participation and dialogue presentation: 
5% X 16 = 80%
II. Midterm and final group presentations, including script and performance: 20%
materials:
1. Good Chats (3rd edition),by Sandsberry, Sorenson, and Ring. Taipei: Bookman, 2008.
2. Essential Idioms in English (New Edition), by Dixson. New York: Pearson Education, 1994.
3. Dictionary of Idioms, by Terban.  New York:  Scholastic, 1996.
4.Idioms Made Easy:  Stories of Selected English Idioms. By Tseng and Kao. Taipei: Bookman, 2004.
